channel.title: Library of Congress lectures
channel.description:
A series of lectures given at the Library of Congress in Washington, D.C.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Pamela Travers, part one
item.description: This program, the first of three parts, focuses on novelist Pamela Travers, author of "Mary Poppins."
item.dc:creator: Library of Congress
item.dc:subject: Travers, P. L. (Pamela Lyndon), 1899-1996--Characters--Mary Poppins

item.title: John Barth, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, features novelist John Barth.
item.dc:creator: Library of Congress
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: Alan Kernow on New Zealand poets, part three
item.description: This program, the third of three parts, features New Zealand poet Alan Kernow discussing poets of his country.
item.dc:creator: Library of Congress
item.dc:subject: Speeches, addresses, etc

item.title: Yefgenyi Yevtushenko, part one
item.description: This program, the first of three parts, presents Soviet poet Yefgenyi Yevtushenko, in a November 1966 poetry reading at the Library of Congress in Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: Library of Congress
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Alan Kernow on New Zealand poets, part two
item.description: This program, the second of three parts, features New Zealand poet Alan Kernow discussing poets of his country.
item.dc:creator: Library of Congress
item.dc:subject: Speeches, addresses, etc

item.title: Karl Shapiro, part one
item.description: This program, the first of three parts features poet Karl Shapiro, lecturing about poet Randall Jarrell, who died on Oct. 14, 1965, in a Chapel Hill, North Carolina, auto accident. Shapiro spoke on the one-year anniversary in October 1966. Introduction by L. Quincy Mumford.
item.dc:creator: Library of Congress
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: Karl Shapiro, part two
item.description: This program, the second of three parts features poet Karl Shapiro, lecturing about poet Randall Jarrell, who died on Oct. 14, 1965, in a Chapel Hill, North Carolina, auto accident. Shapiro spoke on the one-year anniversary in October 1966. Introduction by L. Quincy Mumford.
item.dc:creator: Library of Congress
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: Pamela Travers, part three
item.description: This program, the third of three parts, focuses on novelist Pamela Travers, author of "Mary Poppins."
item.dc:creator: Library of Congress
item.dc:subject: Travers, P. L. (Pamela Lyndon), 1899-1996--Characters--Mary Poppins

item.title: James Dickey, part one
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, presents Library of Congress consultant in poetry James Dickey on the future of American poetry.
item.dc:creator: Library of Congress
item.dc:subject: United States--Poetry

item.title: Allen Nevins, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, presents American historian Allen Nevins, on the writing of history.
item.dc:creator: Library of Congress
item.dc:subject: Writing

item.title: Hall, Stafford, and Dickey, part one
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, features poets Donald Hall and William Stafford; and Library of Congress consultant in poetry James Dickey.
item.dc:creator: Library of Congress
item.dc:subject: United States--Poetry

item.title: Allen Nevins, part one
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, presents American historian Allen Nevins, on the writing of history. Introduction by Librarian of Congress L. Quincy Mumford.
item.dc:creator: Library of Congress
item.dc:subject: Writing
